intro: Euonymus wui, commonly known as the Chinese burning bush, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its vibrant red foliage in the fall, which makes it a popular ornamental plant. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are ovate to elliptical in shape. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in the spring, followed by orange-red蒴果 that persist into winter. Euonymus wui is relatively low maintenance and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
